facts.1: Halloween is celebrated on October 31st and is known for its spooky decorations, costumes, and trick-or-treating.
facts.2: The holiday has its origins in the ancient Celtic festival of Samhain, which marked the end of the harvest season and the beginning of winter.
facts.3: Halloween is a time for people to enjoy haunted houses, scary movies, and themed parties.

facts.1: National Caramel Apple Day celebrates the delicious treat of apples coated in caramel, often enjoyed during the fall season.
facts.2: Caramel apples are a popular treat at fairs, festivals, and Halloween parties.
facts.3: The day encourages people to make and enjoy caramel apples with various toppings like nuts, chocolate, and sprinkles.

facts.1: National Magic Day is observed on October 31st to honor the art of magic and the contributions of magicians.
facts.2: The day commemorates the death of Harry Houdini, one of the most famous magicians and escape artists in history.
facts.3: National Magic Day encourages people to enjoy magic shows, learn new tricks, and appreciate the skill and creativity of magicians.
